nodes.name: flow battery
description: A flow battery is a battery in which chemical energy is provided by two chemical components dissolved in liquids contained within the system and separated by a membrane. Ion exchange (accompanied by flow of electric current) occurs through the membrane while both liquids circulate in their own respective space.

nodes.name: lithium-ion battery
description: A lithium-ion battery is a battery that is rechargeable and in which lithium ions move from the negative electrode to the positive electrode during discharge, and back when charging. Li-ion batteries use an intercalated lithium compound as one electrode material.

nodes.name: liquid-metal battery
description: A liquid-metal battery is a battery that consists of two molten metal alloys separated by an electrolyte. The rechargeable batteries are used for electric vehicles and potentially also for grid energy storage.

nodes.name: molten-salt battery
description: A molten-salt battery is a battery that uses molten salts as an electrolyte and offers both a high energy density and a high power density.

nodes.name: sodium-ion battery
description: A sodium-ion battery is a rechargeable metal-ion battery that uses sodium ions as charge carriers.

nodes.name: traction battery
description: A traction battery is a battery that is used in vehicles for propulsion.

nodes.name: framework factsheet
description: A framework factsheet is a factsheet that contains information about a software framework.

nodes.name: scenario factsheet
description: A scenario factsheet is a factsheet that contains information about a scenario.

nodes.name: study factsheet
description: A study factsheet is a factsheet that contains information about a scenario study.

nodes.name: gas turbine
description: A gas turbine is a turbine that participates in a gas turbine process. It is also called combustion turbine.

nodes.name: turbine
description: A turbine is an energy converting component that converts energy from a moving fluid flow into rotational energy.

nodes.name: steam turbine
description: A steam turbine is a turbine that converts heat from pressurised steam into rotational energy.

nodes.name: water turbine
description: A water turbine is a turbine converting potential energy and kinetic energy of water into rotational energy.

nodes.name: wind rotor
description: A wind rotor (or wind turbine) is a turbine that converts the wind's kinetic energy into rotational energy.

nodes.name: heater
description: A heater is an energy converting component that converts other forms of energy into useful heat.

nodes.name: water electrolyser
description: A water electrolyser is an energy converting component that uses an electric current to decompose water into hydrogen and oxygen gas. Electrical energy is converted into chemical energy (and waste heat).

nodes.name: steam reformer
description: A steam reformer is an energy converting component that produces syngas from hydrocarbons such as natural gas.

nodes.name: motor
description: A motor is an energy converting component that converts other forms of energy into kinetic energy.

nodes.name: pump
description: A pump is an energy converting component that converts energy into kinetic or potential energy of a fluid.

nodes.name: current collector
description: A current collector is an energy converting component that transfers electrical energy between a stationary conductor and a grid supplied electric vehicle.

nodes.name: heat exchanger
description: A heat exchanger is an energy converting component that is used for a heat transfer process.

nodes.name: greenhouse gas emission
description: A greenhouse gas emission is an emission that releases a greenhouse gas.

nodes.name: sectoral emission
description: A sectoral emission is an emission caused by a certain sector.

nodes.name: carbon dioxide emission
description: A CO2 emission is an emission that releases carbon dioxide.

nodes.name: object aggregate
editor_note: An entity a is an object aggregate if and only if there is a mutually exhaustive and pairwise disjoint partition of a into objects

BFO 2 Reference: object aggregates may gain and lose parts while remaining numerically identical (one and the same individual) over time. This holds both for aggregates whose membership is determined naturally (the aggregate of cells in your body) and aggregates determined by fiat (a baseball team, a congressional committee).

nodes.name: population
description: A population is an aggregate of people in a spatial region.

nodes.name: transport network
description: A transport network is an object aggregate of transport network components that enables the transport of people and/or goods.

nodes.name: lignite
description: Lignite is coal that is non-agglomerating with a gross calorific value less than 17 435 kJ/kg (4 165 kcal/kg) and greater than 31 % volatile matter on a dry mineral matter free basis.

nodes.name: sub bituminous coal
description: Sub bituminous coal is coal that is non-agglomerating with a gross calorific value between 17 435 kJ/kg (4 165 kcal/kg) and 23 865 kJ/kg (5 700 kcal/kg) containing more than 31 % volatile matter on a dry mineral matter free basis.

nodes.name: hard coal power plant
description: A hard coal power plant is a coal power plant that has hard coal power units as parts.

nodes.name: lignite power plant
description: A lignite power plant is a coal power plant that has lignite power units as parts.

nodes.name: solar thermal collector
description: A solar thermal collector is a heater that converts solar energy to solar thermal energy.

nodes.name: boiler
description: A boiler is a heater that increases the thermal energy of fluids.

nodes.name: combustion-based heater
description: A combustion-based heater is a heater that increases the thermal energy using combustion.

nodes.name: electrical heater
description: An electrical heater is a heater that increases the thermal energy using electric energy.

nodes.name: heating and cooling sector
description: A heating and cooling sector is a sector that covers heating and cooling activities.

nodes.name: household sector
description: A household sector is a sector that covers households.

nodes.name: commercial sector
description: A commercial sector is a sector that covers non-industrial commercial activities.

nodes.name: transport sector
description: A transport sector is a sector that covers transport of people and/or goods.

nodes.name: building sector
description: A building sector is a sector that covers buildings.

nodes.name: hydro energy
description: Hydro energy is kinetic energy of moving liquid water which can result directly from its potential energy.

nodes.name: wind energy
description: Wind energy is the kinetic energy of moving air.

nodes.name: rotational energy
description: Rotational energy is the kinetic energy that a material entity possesses due to its rotational motion.

nodes.name: hydrogen turbine
description: A hydrogen turbine is a gas turbine fueled with hydrogen.

nodes.name: jet fuel turbine
description: A jet fuel turbine is a turbine fueled with jet fuel.

nodes.name: natural gas turbine
description: A natural gas turbine is a gas turbine fueled with natural gas.

nodes.name: industrial waste fuel
description: An industrial waste fuel is waste fuel produced by industry.

nodes.name: municipal waste fuel
description: A municipal waste fuel is waste fuel produced by households or non-industrial commercial activities.

nodes.name: biogenic waste fuel
description: A biogenic waste fuel is a waste fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: fossil waste fuel
description: A fossil waste fuel is a waste fuel that has a fossil origin.

nodes.name: institution
description: An institution is an organisation that serves a social purpose.

nodes.name: organisation
description: An organisation is an immaterial entity that has the organisation role and there exists some sort of legal framework that recognises the entity and its continued existence.

nodes.name: political party
description: A political party is an organisation of a group of people with common views or goals that wants to have influence in politics.

nodes.name: market exchange
description: A market exchange is an organisation that has the market exchange role.

nodes.name: organisational energy producer
description: An organisational energy producer is an organisation that undertakes the generation of electricity and/or heat."

nodes.name: jet fuel
description: Jet fuel is kerosene used for aviation turbine power units. It has the same distillation characteristics between 150 °C and 300 °C (generally not above 250 °C) and flash point as kerosene. In addition, it has particular specifications (such as freezing point) which are established by the International Air Transport Association (IATA).

nodes.name: liquid biofuel
description: A liquid biofuel is a biofuel that has liquid as its normal state of matter.

nodes.name: solid biofuel
description: Solid biomass is a portion of matter consisting of organic, non-fossil material of biological origin which may be used as fuel for heat production or electricity generation.

nodes.name: sustainable biofuel
description: A sustainable biofuel is a biofuel that does conform to sustainability criteria.

nodes.name: non-sustainable biofuel
description: A non-sustainable biofuel is a biofuel that does not conform to sustainability criteria.

nodes.name: energy market model
description: An energy market model is a model that is about the energy market.

nodes.name: model
description: A model is a generically dependent continuant that is used for computing an idealised reproduction of a system and its behaviours.

nodes.name: optimisation model
description: An optimisation model is a model that optimises a target function.

nodes.name: simulation model
description: A simulation model is a model that simulates the behaviour of a system without a target function.

nodes.name: single node model
description: A single node model is a model where a region is represented as a single node.

nodes.name: electricity transshipment model
description: An electricity transshipment model is a model that applies the transshipment problem to the electricity grid.

nodes.name: energy system model
description: An energy system model is a model of an energy system.

nodes.name: power-to-methane system
description: A power-to-methane system is a power-to-gas system that implements the power-to-methane process.

nodes.name: power-to-gas system
description: A power-to-gas system is a power-to-fuel system that implements a power-to-gas process. A water electrolyser is participating in the power-to-gas process.

nodes.name: power-to-ammonia system
description: A power-to-ammonia system is a power-to-gas system that implements the power-to-ammonia process.

nodes.name: generically dependent continuant
description: b is a generically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [074-001])

nodes.name: model component
description: A model component is a generically dependent continuant that is part of a model.

nodes.name: sector division
description: A sector division is a specific way to subdivide a system.

nodes.name: unit of measurement
description: A unit of measurement is a standardised quantity of a quantifiable entity.

nodes.name: non-methane volatile organic compound
description: A non-methane volatile organic compound (NMVOC) is a volatile organic compound other than methane.

nodes.name: fossil municipal waste fuel
description: A fossil municipal waste fuel is an municipal waste fuel that has a fossil origin.

nodes.name: biogenic municipal waste fuel
description: A biogenic municipal waste fuel is a municipal waste fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: offshore wind farm
description: An offshore wind farm is a wind farm that is build in a body of water, usually the ocean.

nodes.name: onshore wind farm
description: An onshore wind farm is a wind farm that is build on land.

nodes.name: open source
description: open source is a software descriptor labelling software whose source code is available online for free and can be modified or redistributed.

nodes.name: optimisation
description: An optimisation is a model calculation with the goal to find a best choice or result for at least one variable or function in the model.

nodes.name: simulation
description: A simulation is a model calculation that simulates a process or system behaviour from the real world.

nodes.name: solar thermal power plant
description: A solar thermal power plant is a solar power plant that has solar thermal power units as parts.

nodes.name: political assumption
description: A political assumption is an assumption about political measures taken.

nodes.name: power-to-liquid system
description: A power-to-liquid system is a power-to-fuel system that implements a power-to-liquid process. A water electrolyser is participating in the power-to-liquid process.

nodes.name: pumped water
description: Pumped water is liquid water which was pumped into an upper reservoir and thus contains potential energy.

nodes.name: liquid water
description: Liquid water is water that has a liquid state of matter.

nodes.name: water body
description: A water body is an accumulation of liquid water of varying size on the surface of the Earth.

nodes.name: sodium-sulphur battery
description: A sodium–sulphur battery is a type of molten-salt battery constructed from liquid sodium (Na) and sulphur (S). This type of battery has a high energy density, high efficiency of charge/discharge and long cycle life, and is fabricated from inexpensive materials. The operating temperatures of 300 to 350 °C and the highly corrosive nature of the sodium polysulphides, primarily make them suitable for stationary energy storage applications. The cell becomes more economical with increasing size.

nodes.name: solar energy
description: Solar energy is radiative energy of the sun.

nodes.name: solid fossil fuel
description: A solid fossil fuel is a fossil fuel that has a solid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: liquid fossil fuel
description: A liquid fossil fuel is a fossil combustion fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: gaseous fossil fuel
description: A gaseous fossil fuel is a fossil combustion fuel that has a gaseous state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: mineral oil product
description: A mineral oil product is a fossil combustion fuel produced in a mineral oil refining process.

nodes.name: mineral oil
description: A mineral oil is a fossil combustion fuel that is either crude oil or a mineral oil product.

nodes.name: technology
description: A technology is a plan specification that describes how to combine artificial objects or other material entities and processes in a specific way.

nodes.name: plan specification
description: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts, and that may be concretized as a realizable entity that, if realized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.
editor_note: 2009-03-16: provenance: a term a plan was proposed for OBI (OBI_0000344) , edited by the PlanAndPlannedProcess branch. Original definition was " a plan is a specification of a process that is realized by an actor to achieve the objective specified as part of the plan". It has been subsequently moved to IAO where the objective for which the original term was defined was satisfied with the definitionof this, different, term.
2014-03-31: A plan specification can have other parts, such as conditional specifications.
2022-01-16 Updated definition to that proposed by Clint Dowloand, IAO Issue 231.
Alternative previous definition: a plan is a set of instructions that specify how an objective should be achieved

nodes.name: sustainability criterion
description: A sustainability criterion is a plan specification that intends to meet the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own environmental, economic and social needs.

nodes.name: methodology
description: A methodology is a plan specification that describes processes that are part of a study.

nodes.name: dispatch assignment
description: Dispatch assignment is a plan specification that refers to resource planning at a power plant (usually by the plant’s operator).

nodes.name: merit order
description: A merit order is a plan specification that describes the dispatch ranking of power plants (electrical generation) based on ascending order of price.

nodes.name: policy instrument
description: A policy instrument is a plan specification of an organisation (e.g. a government) that promotes transformative measures.

nodes.name: programming language
description: A language in which source code is written that is intended to be executed/run by a software interpreter. Programming languages are ways to write instructions that specify what to do, and sometimes, how to do it.

nodes.name: algorithm
description: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.

nodes.name: underground hydrogen storage object
description: An underground hydrogen storage is an underground fuel storage object that stores hydrogen. Examples are underground caverns, salt domes and depleted oil/gas fields.

nodes.name: wood
description: Wood is a biomass from trees. It has a solid state of matter an can be used as fuel.

nodes.name: nitric oxide
description: Nitric oxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula NO. It is a gas and can act as an air pollutant. Synonyms are nitrogen oxide or nitrogen monoxide.

nodes.name: nitrogen dioxide
description: Nitrogen dioxide is a portion of matter with the chemical formula NO2. It is a gas and can act as an air pollutant.

nodes.name: PM10
description: PM10 is particulate matter which passes through a size-selective inlet as defined in the reference method for the sampling and measurement of PM10, EN 12341, with a 50 % efficiency cut-off at 10 µm aerodynamic diameter.

nodes.name: PM2.5
description: PM2.5 is particulate matter which passes through a size-selective inlet as defined in the reference method for the sampling and measurement of PM2,5, EN 14907, with a 50 % efficiency cut-off at 2,5 µm aerodynamic diameter.

nodes.name: fossil hydrogen
description: Fossil hydrogen is hydrogen with fossil origin.

nodes.name: synthetic hydrogen
description: Synthetic hydrogen is hydrogen with synthetic origin.

nodes.name: electrolytic hydrogen
description: Electrolytic hydrogen is hydrogen that is a physical output of a water electrolysis process.

nodes.name: steam reforming hydrogen
description: Steam reforming hydrogen is hydrogen that is a physical output of a steam reforming process.

nodes.name: fossil steam reforming hydrogen
description: Fossil steam reforming hydrogen is hydrogen that is produced from a fossil combustion fuel in a steam reforming process which is not followed by a carbon capture and storage process.

nodes.name: abated steam reforming hydrogen
description: Abated steam reforming hydrogen is hydrogen that is output of a steam reforming process which is followed by a carbon capture and storage process.

nodes.name: synthetic methane
description: Synthetic methane is methane that has a synthetic origin.

nodes.name: PtL fuel
description: PtL fuel is a liquid synthetic fuel produced in a power-to-liquid system from water and carbon dioxide using electrical energy.

nodes.name: liquid synthetic fuel
description: A liquid synthetic fuel is a synthetic fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: battery electric vehicle
description: A battery electric vehicle (BEV) is an electric vehicle that stores energy in a traction battery.

nodes.name: fuel cell electric vehicle
description: A fuel cell electric vehicle (FCEV) is an electric vehicle that uses electrical energy from a fuel cell.

nodes.name: grid supplied electric vehicle
description: A grid supplied electric vehicle is an electric vehicle that has a current collector to use electrical energy.

nodes.name: electric motor
description: An electric motor is a motor that converts electrical energy into kinetic energy.

nodes.name: internal combustion engine
description: An internal combustion engine is a motor that converts chemical energy into kinetic energy using a cyclic combustion process.

nodes.name: traction motor
description: A traction motor is a motor that is used for propulsion.

nodes.name: electric traction motor
description: An electric traction motor is an electric motor used for propulsion.

nodes.name: common reporting format
description: The common reporting format (CRF) is a sector division used for compiling national inventory reports on greenhouse gas emissions and providing emission relevant data in so called CRF tables.

nodes.name: EU emission sector division
description: An EU emission sector division is used in the EU climate policy.

nodes.name: CRF-based sector division
description: A CRF-based sector division is a sector division that is derived from a common reporting format.

nodes.name: EU legislation sector division
description: An EU legislation sector division is a sector division that is used in EU legislation.

nodes.name: energy balance sector division
description: An energy balance sector division is a sector division that is defined by an energy balance calculation method.

nodes.name: areal power density unit
description: An areal power density unit is a unit which is a measure for the power per surface area.

nodes.name: areal energy density unit
description: An areal energy density unit is a unit which is a measure for the energy per surface area.

nodes.name: area per power unit
description: An area per power unit is a unit which is a measure for an area per nameplate capacity.

nodes.name: currency
description: A unit which is a measure of the medium of an exchange value, defined by reference to the geographical location of the monetary authorities responsible for it.

nodes.name: transport performance unit
description: A transport performance unit is a unit of measurement for the accumulated transport distance of a number of people and/or amount of goods.

nodes.name: length unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points.

nodes.name: mass unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object.

nodes.name: time unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence.

nodes.name: electric current unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the flow of electric charge.

nodes.name: temperature unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter.

nodes.name: substance unit
description: A unit which is a standardised quantity of an element or compound with uniform composition.

nodes.name: base unit
description: A unit which is one of a particular measure to which all measures of that type can be related.

nodes.name: area unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of a 2-dimensional flat surface.

nodes.name: acceleration unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of change of velocity in either speed or direction.

nodes.name: angular velocity unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of angular movement about an axis; the angle rotated in a given time.

nodes.name: angular acceleration unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of change of angular velocity.

nodes.name: concentration unit
description: A unit which represents a standard measurement of how much of a given substance there is mixed with another substance.

nodes.name: momentum unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity of motion measured by the product of mass and velocity.

nodes.name: speed/velocity unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the rate of movement. Speed is measured in the same physical units of measurement as velocity, but does not contain the element of direction that velocity has. Speed is thus the magnitude component of velocity.

nodes.name: volume unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of space occupied by any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas.

nodes.name: frequency unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the number of repetitive actions in a particular time.

nodes.name: force unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the force is applied when a mass is accelerated.

nodes.name: pressure unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the force applied to a given area.

nodes.name: energy unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the work done by a certain force (gravitational, electric, magnetic, force of inertia, etc).

nodes.name: power unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure power or the rate of doing work.

nodes.name: catalytic activity unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of the action of a catalyst.

nodes.name: angle unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the figure or space formed by the junction of two lines or planes.

nodes.name: radiation unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of radiation emitted by a given radiation source as well as the amount of radiation absorbed or deposited in a specific material by a radiation source.

nodes.name: light unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the intensity of light.

nodes.name: density unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the influence exerted by some mass.

nodes.name: dimensionless unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of physical quantity consisting of only a numerical number without any units.

nodes.name: electric potential difference unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the work done per unit charge as a charge is moved between two points in an electric field.

nodes.name: electric charge
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons.

nodes.name: magnetic flux unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of quantity of magnetism, taking account of the strength and the extent of a magnetic field.

nodes.name: magnetic flux density unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the strength of a magnetic field.

nodes.name: information unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of information.

nodes.name: surface tension unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the ability of a liguid to attraction of molecules at its surface as a result of unbalanced molecular cohesive forces.

nodes.name: viscosity unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the internal resistance of fluids to flow.

nodes.name: conduction unit
description: A unit which represents a standard measurement of the transmission of an entity through a medium.

nodes.name: electric field strength unit
description: The electric field strength is a unit which is a measure of the potential difference between two points some distance apart.

nodes.name: volumetric flow rate unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time .

nodes.name: rate unit
description: A unit which represents a standard measurement occurrence of a process per unit time.

nodes.name: turbidity unit
description: A unit used to indicate the clarity of water or other solutions or suspensions, as measured by the ability of the solution or suspension to scatter light of a defined wavelength range.

nodes.name: areal power density
description: An areal power density is a quantity value that indicates a certain power per area.

nodes.name: areal energy density
description: An areal energy density is a quantity value that states a certain energy amount per area.

nodes.name: global warming potential
description: Global warming potential (GWP) is a quantity value that measures the the time-integrated radiative forcing due to a pulse emission of a given component, relative to a pulse emission of an equal mass of carbon dioxide (CO2).

nodes.name: emission quantity value
description: An emission quantity value is a quantity value that has a mass unit as unit. It is the quantity value of an emission value.

nodes.name: power value
description: A power value is a quantity value that has a power unit as unit.

nodes.name: forecast error
description: A forecast error is a quantity value that quantifies the difference between a measured and a forecasted value.

nodes.name: maximum value
description: A maximum value is a quantity value that represents the upper limit of an artificial object or process to contain or transform another entity.

nodes.name: specific space requirement
description: A specific space requirement is a quantity value that indicates a certain space requirement per nameplate capacity.

nodes.name: area value
description: An area value is a quantity value indicating the size of a two-dimensional spatial region.

nodes.name: time span
description: A time span is a quantity value indicating the duration of a one-dimensional temporal region, measured in a time unit.

nodes.name: energy amount value
description: An energy amount value is a quantity value that has an energy unit as unit.

nodes.name: volumetric flow rate value
description: A volumetric flow rate value is a quantity value that has a volumetric flow rate unit as unit.

nodes.name: length value
description: Length value is a quantity value that has a length unit as unit.

nodes.name: economic value
description: An economic value is a quantity value that is economically relevant.

nodes.name: efficiency value
description: An efficiency value is a quantity value stating the ratio between a process's inputs and the outputs that are used.

nodes.name: coefficient of performance value
description: A coefficient of performance value is a quantity value stating the ratio between the work input and the total output of an energy conversion process.

nodes.name: fraction value
description: A fraction value is a quantity value that has a fraction as it's unit.

nodes.name: full load hours
description: Full load hours are a quantity value that describes the utilization of a technical device. The value of the full load hours is obtained by dividing the annual amount of energy generated by the declared net capacity of the plant.

nodes.name: slope
description: A slope is a quantity value with a plane angle unit that measures the angle between the plane of a surface and the horizontal plane.

nodes.name: transport performance value
description: A transport performance value is a quantity value that indicates the performance of a transport process in terms of its mileage and amount of transported people and/or goods.

nodes.name: volume
description: A volume is a quantity value indicating the size of a three-dimensional spatial region.

nodes.name: population count
description: A population count is a quantity value to measure the size of a population.

nodes.name: surface azimuth angle
description: A surface azimuth angle is a quantity value with a plane angle unit that measures the deviation of the projection on a horizontal plane of the normal to the plane from the local meridian, with zero due south, east negative, and west positive.

nodes.name: areal solar power density
description: An areal solar power density is an areal power density that indicates the arriving solar power per area. A synonym for areal solar power density is irradiance.

nodes.name: areal solar energy density
description: An areal solar energy density is an areal energy density that gives the arriving solar power per area. A synonym for areal solar power density is irradiation.

nodes.name: solar-steam-electric process
description: A solar-steam-electric process is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into electrical energy. It has two partial processes: a solar thermal energy transformation and a steam-electric process.

nodes.name: solar energy transformation
description: Solar energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts solar energy.

nodes.name: solar chemical energy transformation
description: A solar chemical energy transformation is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into chemical energy.

nodes.name: solar thermal energy transformation
description: Solar thermal energy transformation is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into thermal energy.

nodes.name: photovoltaic energy transformation
description: Photovoltaic energy transformation is a solar energy transformation that converts solar energy into electrical energy.

nodes.name: run of river power plant
description: A run of river power plant is a hydro power plant that uses the momentarily available hydro energy of a river. It has either no reservoir or just has a small one with a maximum of 24 hours of storage.
editor_note: The distinction between a run of river power plant and a hydro storage power plant is important for modelling, but in reality not so easy. The chosen distinction follows the document: European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (ENTSO-E): Hydropower modelling – New database complementing PECD, V.1.0, 12 December 2019, https://www.entsoe.eu/Documents/SDC%20documents/MAF/2019/Hydropower_Modelling_New_database_and_methodology.pdf

nodes.name: hydro storage power plant
description: A hydro storage power plant is a hydro power plant that uses the available hydro energy of a stationary water storage.
editor_note: The distinction between a run of river power plant and a hydro storage power plant is important for modelling, but in reality not so easy. The chosen distinction follows the document: European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (ENTSO-E): Hydropower modelling – New database complementing PECD, V.1.0, 12 December 2019, https://www.entsoe.eu/Documents/SDC%20documents/MAF/2019/Hydropower_Modelling_New_database_and_methodology.pdf

nodes.name: marine current energy power plant
description: A marine current energy power plant is a power plant that has marine current energy units as parts.

nodes.name: marine tidal energy power plant
description: A marine tidal energy power plant is a power plant that has marine tidal energy units as parts.

nodes.name: marine wave energy power plant
description: A marine wave energy power plant is a power plant that has marine wave energy units as parts.

nodes.name: pumped hydro storage power plant
description: A pumped hydro storage power plant is a hydro storage power plant which has some pumps as parts.

nodes.name: reservoir hydro storage power plant
description: A reservoir hydro storage power plant is a hydro storage power plant that has no pump.

nodes.name: open-loop pumped hydro storage power plant
description: An open-loop pumped hydro storage power plant is a pumped hydro storage power plant that has natural inflows.

nodes.name: closed-loop pumped hydro storage power plant
description: A closed-loop pumped hydro storage power plant is a pumped hydro storage power plant that has no natural inflows.

nodes.name: river
description: A river is a water body that moves through permanent or seasonal flow process from elevated land towards lower elevations through a definite channel and empties either into a sea, lake, or another river or ends on land as bed seepage and evapotranspiration exceed water supply.

nodes.name: ocean
description: The ocean is a water body that consists of salt water and is covering approximately 71% of Earth's surface.

nodes.name: marine thermal energy
description: Marine thermal energy is a kind of natural ambient thermal energy that is present in marine water bodies.

nodes.name: natural ambient thermal energy
description: Natural ambient thermal energy is ambient thermal energy that has a renewable origin.

nodes.name: aerothermal energy
description: Aerothermal energy is a natural ambient thermal energy that is stored in the air of a natural environment.

nodes.name: marine thermal energy transfer
description: Marine thermal energy transfer is a heat transfer from the marine water body to a transportable material entity.

nodes.name: heat transfer
description: Heat transfer is an energy transfer of thermal energy.

nodes.name: geothermal heat transfer
description: Geothermal heat transfer is a heat transfer from the earth crust to a transportable material entity. E.g. a liquid or gas.

nodes.name: ambient thermal energy transfer
description: Ambient thermal energy transfer is a heat transfer from the ambient air to a transportable material entity.

nodes.name: marine current energy
description: Marine current energy is the natural hydro energy of an ocean current.

nodes.name: natural hydro energy
description: Natural hydro energy is hydro energy collected from the natural water cycle (rainwater, melted snow and ice).

nodes.name: marine tidal energy
description: Marine tidal energy is the natural hydro energy of a tidal flow.

nodes.name: marine wave energy
description: Marine wave energy is the natural hydro energy of a wave.

nodes.name: marine current energy transformation
description: Marine current energy transformation is a hydroelectric energy transformation that converts marine current energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: hydroelectric energy transformation
description: Hydroelectric energy transformation is a hydro energy transformation that converts hydro energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: marine tidal energy transformation
description: Marine tidal energy transformation is a hydroelectric energy transformation that converts kinetic energy from tidal flow to electrical energy.

nodes.name: marine wave energy transformation
description: Marine wave energy transformation is a hydroelectric energy transformation that converts marine wave energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: tidal flow
description: Tidal flow is a water flow during which movements of water masses caused by varying gravitational and rotational forces from sun and moon, combined with the rotation of the earth, cause waters to undergo periodic depth oscillations (tides).

nodes.name: wave
description: A wave is a water flow that is at the surface of a water body/marine water body/ocean and that is mainly vertically orientated.

nodes.name: ocean current
description: An ocean current is a a water flow within a water body/marine water body/ocean that is mainly horizontally orientated.

nodes.name: marine current energy converting unit
description: A marine current energy converting unit is a hydro power unit that uses marine current energy.

nodes.name: marine tidal energy converting unit
description: A marine tidal energy converting unit is a hydro power unit that uses marine tidal energy.

nodes.name: economy
description: An economy is a system of production, distribution, trade and consumption of goods and services.

nodes.name: system
description: A material entity consisting of multiple components that are causally integrated.
editor_note: May be replaced by a BFO class, as discussed in http://www.jbiomedsem.com/content/4/1/43

nodes.name: climate system
description: A climate system is a system that has five interacting components: the atmosphere (air), the hydrosphere (water), the cryosphere (ice and permafrost), the lithosphere (earth's upper rocky layer) and the biosphere (living things).

nodes.name: supply system
description: A supply system is a system that connects producers and consumers.

nodes.name: good
description: A good is a continuant that has the good role.

nodes.name: continuant
description: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Continuant entities are entities which can be sliced to yield parts only along the spatial dimension, yielding for example the parts of your table which we call its legs, its top, its nails. ‘My desk stretches from the window to the door. It has spatial parts, and can be sliced (in space) in two. With respect to time, however, a thing is a continuant.’ [60, p. 240

Continuant doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. For example, in an expansion involving bringing in some of Ceuster's other portions of reality, questions are raised as to whether universals are continuants

nodes.name: independent continuant
description: A continuant that is a bearer of quality and realizable entity entities, in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything.
b is an independent continuant = Def. b is a continuant which is such that there is no c and no t such that b s-depends_on c at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [017-002])

nodes.name: specifically dependent continuant
description: b is a specifically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant & there is some independent continuant c which is not a spatial region and which is such that b s-depends_on c at every time t during the course of b’s existence. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [050-003])
editor_note: Specifically dependent continuant doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't necessarily exhaust all possibilites. We're not sure what else will develop here, but for example there are questions such as what are promises, obligation, etc.

nodes.name: effort sharing
description: Effort sharing is a policy instrument that sets a common emission reduction goal for a number of countries. Each country has a national reduction goal. Under- or overachievement of that goal can be compensated by trading emission certificates.

nodes.name: feed-in tariff
description: A feed-in tariff is a policy instrument designed to stimulate investment in renewable energy technologies by offering long-term contracts to agents who are producers of renewable energy.

nodes.name: market premium
description: A market premium is a policy instrument that ensures a guaranteed remuneration, e.g. a fixed feed-in tariff, by paying to the producing agent the difference between a guaranteed return on a good/product and the monetary price for which the good/product is traded on the market

nodes.name: levy
description: A levy is a policy instrument that consists of a compulsory financial charge imposed on an agent or institution by a governmental organisation.

nodes.name: Annual Emission Allocation
description: An Annual Emission Allocation (AEA) is an emission certificate used in the Effort Sharing Decision (ESD) and the Effort Sharing Regulation (ESR). It permits the emission of a CO2 equivalent quantity of 1 tonne.

nodes.name: emission certificate
description: An emission certificate is a licence that permits its holder/owner a specific emission value. An emission certificate can be traded at a CO2 market exchange.

nodes.name: EU allowance
description: An EU Allowance (EUA) is an emission certificate used in the European Union Emissions Trading System (EU ETS). It permits the emission of a CO2 equivalent quantity of 1 tonne.

nodes.name: secondary energy production
description: Secondary energy production is the production of secondary energy carriers.

nodes.name: fuel production
description: Fuel production is a production process which has fuel as physical output.

nodes.name: primary energy production
description: Primary energy production is a production that prepares raw material for its use as primary energy carrier.

nodes.name: liquid air production
description: Liquid air production is a production that produces liquid air by cooling and compressing (gaseous) air.

nodes.name: metric ton
description: Metric ton (t) is a a mass unit which is equal to thousand of a kilogram or 10^3 kg.

nodes.name: kilogram
description: A mass unit which is equal to the mass of the International Prototype Kilogram kept by the BIPM at Svres, France.

nodes.name: gram
description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a kilogram or 10^[-3] kg.

nodes.name: milligram
description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gram or 10^[-3] g.

nodes.name: microgram
description: A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g.

nodes.name: nanogram
description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a gram or 10^[-9] g.

nodes.name: picogram
description: A mass unit which is equal to 10^[-12] g.

nodes.name: femtogram
description: A mass unit which is equal to 10^[-15] g.

nodes.name: molar mass unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the mass of a homogeneous substance containing 6.02 x 1023 atoms or molecules.

nodes.name: dalton
description: An independently to the base SI units defined mass unit which is equal to one twelfth of the mass of an unbound atom of the carbon-12 nuclide, at rest and in its ground state.

nodes.name: kilodalton
description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousand daltons.

nodes.name: milli
description: A mass unit which is equal to 1/12 the mass of 12C

nodes.name: grain
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 64.798,91 milligrams.

nodes.name: drachm
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 1.771,845,195,3125 grams, or 1/256 of 1 pound.

nodes.name: ounce
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 28.349,523,125 grams, or 1/16 of 1 pound.

nodes.name: pound
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 453.592,37 grams.

nodes.name: stone
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 6,350.293,18 grams, or 14 pounds.

nodes.name: quarter
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 12.700,586,36 kilograms, or 28 pounds.

nodes.name: hundredweight
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 50.802,345,44 kilograms, 112 pounds, or 8 stone.

nodes.name: ton
description: An imperial mass unit which is equivalent to 1,016.046,9088 kilograms, or 2,240 pounds.

nodes.name: direct air capture
description: Direct air capture (DAC) is carbon dioxide capture from air.

nodes.name: solid renewable fuel
description: A solid renewable fuel is a renewable fuel that has a solid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: liquid renewable fuel
description: A liquid renewable fuel is a renewable fuel that has a liquid state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: gaseous renewable fuel
description: A gaseous renewable fuel is a renewable fuel that has a gaseous state of matter under normal conditions.

nodes.name: energy use
description: Energy use is the consumption of an energy carrier making use of the energy it carries.

nodes.name: non-energy use
description: Non-energy use is the consumption of an energy carrier without making use the energy it carries.

nodes.name: decarbonisation pathway
description: A decarbonisation pathway is a policy that aims at long-term emissions reductions.

nodes.name: policy
description: A policy is a specifically dependent continuant that is a deliberate system of principles, rules and guidelines, adopted by an organisation to guide decision making with respect to particular situations and implemented to achieve stated goals.

nodes.name: emission constraint
description: An emission constraint is a constraint that determines the emissions a model calculation describes.

nodes.name: power-to-gas process
description: A power-to-gas process is a power-to-fuel process that converts electrical energy to chemical energy by synthesising portions of matter into a gaseous synthetic fuel.

nodes.name: power-to-fuel process
description: A power-to-fuel process is an energy transformation that converts electrical energy to chemical energy by synthesising portions of matter into a synthetic fuel.

nodes.name: power-to-liquid process
description: A power-to-liquid process is a power-to-fuel process that converts electrical energy to chemical energy by synthesising portions of matter into a liquid synthetic fuel.

nodes.name: power-to-methane process
description: A power-to-methane process is a power-to-gas process that has electrical energy as energy input, water and carbon dioxide as physical input and synthetic methane carrying chemical energy as physical output. It consists of two sub processes: an electrolysis process and a methanation.

nodes.name: power-to-ammonia process
description: A power-to-ammonia process is a power-to-gas process that has ammonia as output.

nodes.name: water electrolysis process
description: A water electrolysis process is an energy transformation that uses an electric current to decompose water into hydrogen and oxygen gas. Electrical energy is converted into chemical energy (and waste heat).

nodes.name: wind energy transformation
description: Wind energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts wind energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: nuclear energy transformation
description: Nuclear energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts nuclear binding energy to thermal energy.

nodes.name: energy transfer
description: Energy transfer is an energy transformation in form of a spatial transmission, that does not change the types of energies, apart from losses, e.g. waste heat.

nodes.name: propulsion
description: Propulsion is an energy transformation that converts other forms of energy to kinetic energy.

nodes.name: steam-electric process
description: A steam-electric process is an energy transformation that converts thermal energy to electrical energy. A steam turbine and an electro motive generator are participating in a steam-electric process.

nodes.name: hydro energy transformation
description: Hydro energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts hydro energy.

nodes.name: combined heat and power generation process
description: A combined heat and power generation (CHP) process is an energy transformation that converts energy simultaneously to electrical energy and thermal energy.

nodes.name: electricity generation process
description: An electricity generation process is an energy transformation that has electrical energy as physical output.

nodes.name: gas turbine process
description: A gas turbine process is an energy transformation that converts chemical energy into rotational energy using a continous internal combustion process. A gas turbine is participating in a gas turbine process.

nodes.name: heat generation process
description: A heat generation process is an energy transformation that has thermal energy as energy output.

nodes.name: combustion thermal energy transformation
description: A combustion thermal energy transformation is an energy transformation that converts chemical energy of a combustion fuel into thermal energy.

nodes.name: methanation
description: A methanation is a redox reaction that converts carbon dioxide and hydrogen to synthetic methane and water.

nodes.name: redox reaction
description: A redox reaction is a chemical reaction in which the oxidation of one reactant is coupled to the reduction of a second reactant.

nodes.name: combustion
description: Combustion is an exothermic redox reaction between a fuel (the reductant) and an oxidant (usually atmospheric oxygen) which is initiated by a ignition source.

nodes.name: synthetic ammonia
description: Synthetic ammonia is ammonia that has a synthetic origin.

nodes.name: biogenic industrial waste fuel
description: A biogenic industrial waste fuel is an industrial waste fuel that has a biogenic origin.

nodes.name: fossil industrial waste fuel
description: A fossil industrial waste fuel is an industrial waste fuel that has a fossil origin.

nodes.name: nationally determined contribution
description: A nationally determined contribution (NDC) is a target description of future greenhouse gas emission reductions prepared, communicated and maintained by a party to the Paris Agreement.

nodes.name: power capacity
description: A power capacity is a maximum value of a generator or power generating unit to generate power.

nodes.name: energy storage capacity
description: An energy storage capacity is the quantity value stating the maximum energy an energy storage object can store.

nodes.name: potential
description: A potential is a maximum value that describes some upper limit in a spatial region of reference.

nodes.name: bioenergy
description: Bioenergy is chemical energy that is stored in biofuels.

nodes.name: fossil energy
description: Fossil energy is chemical energy that is stored in fossil combustion fuels and thus has a conventional origin.

nodes.name: passenger transport
description: A passenger transport is a transport process in which people are moved in a vehicle from one place to another.

nodes.name: international transport
description: International transport is a transport process between different countries or within the same country via another country.

nodes.name: freight transport
description: Freight transport is a transport process which moves goods from one place to another.

nodes.name: energy service demand for passenger-kilometre
description: Energy service demand for passenger-kilometre is the energy service demand that is consumed to transport one person over a distance of one kilometre.

nodes.name: energy service demand
description: An energy service demand is a demand of an agent to use energy as a means to obtain or facilitate desired end services or states.
editor_note: An example is the transport demand for goods or persons (e.g. in person/tonne-kilometres). An other example is the demand for room heating or cooling.

nodes.name: energy service demand for ton-kilometre
description: Energy service demand for ton-kilometre is the energy service demand that is consumed to transport one metric ton over a distance of one kilometre.

nodes.name: steam reforming
description: A steam reforming process is a chemical reaction that converts hydrocarbons and steam to syngas. As it converts chemical energy and thermal energy to a different type of chemical energy (and waste heat), it is also an energy transformation process.

nodes.name: oxidation
description: Oxidation is a chemical reaction that describes the loss of electrons of an atom, an ion, or of certain atoms in a molecule and is a part of a redox reaction.

nodes.name: reduction
description: Reduction is a chemical reaction that describes the gain of electrons of an atom, an ion, or of certain atoms in a molecule and is a part of a redox reaction.

nodes.name: electrochemical reaction
description: An electrochemical reaction is a chemical reaction that describes the overall reactions of individual redox reactions being separated but connected by an external electric circuit and an intervening electrolyte.

nodes.name: emission price
description: An emission price is a monetary price of emitting a certain emission value.

nodes.name: monetary price
description: A monetary price is an economic value that describes the amount of money requested, expected, required or given in exchange for something else.

nodes.name: electricity price
description: Electricity price is the monetary price per energy unit of electricity.

nodes.name: import price
description: An import price is the monetary price for the import of a material entity.

nodes.name: export price
description: An export price is the monetary price for the export of a material entity.

nodes.name: CO2 price
description: A CO2 price is an emission price of emitting a certain CO2 emission value.

nodes.name: emission certificate price
description: Emission certificate price is a monetary price of an emission certificate that allows the emission of a certain emission value.

nodes.name: carbon tax value
description: A carbon tax value is a CO2 price that is set by a carbon tax.

nodes.name: CO2 emission certificate price
description: A CO2 emission certificate price is an emission price of an CO2 emission certificate that allows the emission of certain CO2 emission value.

nodes.name: road vehicle
description: A road vehicle is a vehicle that uses roads.

nodes.name: train
description: A train is a vehicle that uses railway tracks.

nodes.name: motorised road vehicle
description: A motorised road vehicle is a road vehicle that has a traction motor.

nodes.name: bicycle
description: A bicycle is a road vehicle that has two wheels and is propelled by a person.

nodes.name: car
description: A car is a motorised road vehicle that is used for passenger transport and has a maximum of eight seats.

nodes.name: bus
description: A bus is a motorised road vehicle that is used for passenger transport and has more than eight seats.

nodes.name: truck
description: A truck is a motorised road vehicle that is used for freight transport.

nodes.name: motorcycle
description: A motorcycle is a motorised road vehicle that has two wheels.

nodes.name: freight train
description: A freight train is a train that is used for freight transport.

nodes.name: passenger train
description: A passenger train is a train that is used for passenger transport.

nodes.name: e-bike
description: An e-bike is a bicycle that is propelled by a person and an electric traction motor.

nodes.name: ship
description: A ship is a watercraft of significant size that is driving on the water surface.

nodes.name: passenger ship
description: A passenger ship is a ship that is used for passenger transport.

nodes.name: cargo ship
description: A cargo ship is a ship that is used for freight transport.

nodes.name: container ship
description: A container ship is a cargo ship used for the transport of containers.

nodes.name: tank ship
description: A tank ship is a cargo ship used for the transport of liquid goods.

nodes.name: airplane
description: An airplane is an aircraft that has fixed wings.

nodes.name: helicopter
description: A helicopter is an aircraft that has rotating wings.

nodes.name: primary energy consumption calculation method
description: A primary energy consumption calculation method is a methodology to calculate primary energy consumption.

nodes.name: energy balance calculation method
description: An energy balance calculation method is a methodology to calculate an energy balance.

nodes.name: life cycle assessment
description: A life cycle assessment is a methodology to calculate and analyse environmental impacts of the life cycle of a material entity or process.

nodes.name: substitution method
description: A substitution method is a primary energy consumption calculation method that treats renewable energy carriers as if they have similar conversion losses as a specified fossil reference energy carrier.

nodes.name: direct equivalent method
description: A direct equivalent method is a primary energy consumption calculation method that quantifies renewable and nuclear energies using its secondary energy content assuming no conversion losses.

nodes.name: physical method
description: A physical method is a method to calculate primary energy consumption that quantifies renewable and nuclear energies by attributing an efficiency value each.

nodes.name: jet fuel vehicle
description: A jet fuel vehicle is a gas turbine vehicle that uses a jet fuel turbine.

nodes.name: NC/BR sector division
description:
The NC/BR sector division is a CRF-based sector division defined by the UNFCCC reporting guidelines on national communications for Parties included in Annex I to the Convention.
(https://unfccc.int/sites/default/files/resource/cp2019_13a01_adv.pdf, 6/CP.25, VI, Table 2)

nodes.name: sectoral energy consumption
description: A sectoral energy consumption is the energy use of a sector.

nodes.name: mineral oil refining process
description: A mineral oil refining process is a secondary energy production that converts crude oil by cracking and distillation into various mineral oil products.

nodes.name: international transport sector
description: An international transport sector is a transport sector of international transport processes.

nodes.name: qualitist
description: A qualitist is an OEP user who mainly interacts with qualitative information.

nodes.name: quantitist
description: A quantitist is an OEP user who mainly interacts with quantitative information.

nodes.name: apinist
description: An apinist is an OEP user who mainly interacts via an API.

nodes.name: renewable electrolytic hydrogen
description: Renewable electrolytic hydrogen is electrolytic hydrogen that is produced with renewable electrical energy.

nodes.name: nuclear electric hydrogen
description: Nuclear electrolytic hydrogen is electrolytic hydrogen that is produced with nuclear electrical energy.

nodes.name: solar electrolytic hydrogen
description: Solar electrolytic hydrogen is electrolytic hydrogen that is produced with solar electrical energy.

nodes.name: renewable electrical energy
description: Renewable electrical energy is electrical energy with a renewable origin.

nodes.name: nuclear electrical energy
description: Nuclear electrical energy is electrical energy with a nuclear origin.

nodes.name: solar electrical energy
description: Solar electrical energy is electrical energy that is energy output of a solar energy transformation.

nodes.name: energy transformation function
description: An energy transformation function is the function of an artificial object that has been engineered to transform input energy into usable output energy of a different type.

nodes.name: energy transfer function
description: An energy transfer function is a function of an artificial object that has been engineered to transfer energy over a spatial distance.

nodes.name: electricity generation function
description: An electricity generation function is an energy transformation function to transform other types of energy to electrical energy.

nodes.name: heat generation function
description: A heat generation function is an energy transformation function to transform other types of energy to thermal energy.

nodes.name: renewable energy transformation function
description: A renewable energy function is the energy transformation function to transform renewable energy.

nodes.name: direct solar radiation
description: Direct solar radiation is radiation that is the non-scattered part of solar radiation from the sun within the extent of the solar disk only.

nodes.name: solar radiation
description: Solar radiation is radiation that is emitted by the sun.
editor_note: Solar radiation is the mereological sum of direct solar radiation and diffuse solar radiation

nodes.name: diffuse solar radiation
description: Diffuse solar radiation is radiation that is the part of solar radiation that has been scattered by gas molecules in the atmosphere and by particles such as cloud droplets and aerosols.

nodes.name: non-scattered radiant flux density
description: A non-scattered radiant flux density is an areal solar power density that measures the direct solar radiation within the extent of the solar disk only (half-angle 0.266 deg).

nodes.name: single axis tracking
description: Single axis tracking is solar tracking in which a radiation receiving surface is following the path of the sun by roting along a fixed axis. Typical axis orientations are North-South or East-West.

nodes.name: two axis tracking
description: Two axis tracking is solar tracking in which a radiation receiving surface is following the sun by rotating around two axes. The surface is always oriented normal.

nodes.name: solar tracked receiving surface
description: A solar tracked receiving surface is a solar radiation receiving surface that participates in solar tracking.

nodes.name: solar radiation receiving surface
description: A solar radiation receiving surface is a surface that is receiving solar energy via solar radiation.

nodes.name: single axis tracked receiving surface
description: A single axis tracked receiving surface is a solar radiation receiving surface that participates in single axis tracking.

nodes.name: two axis tracked receiving surface
description: A two axis tracked receiving surface is a solar radiation receiving surface that participates in two axis tracking.

nodes.name: energy balance
description: An energy balance is an empirical data set that describes a specified set of energy transformations and a specified set of energy carriers in a spatial region for a specific time step (usually a year).

nodes.name: Brent crude
description: Brent crude is a crude oil that is extracted in the North Sea and traded at ICE London.

nodes.name: Western Texas Intermediate
description: Western Texas Intermediate (WTI) is a crude oil that is extracted on US territory and traded at NYMEX New York.

nodes.name: creative work licence
description: A creative work licence is a copyright license that determines ownership and permissions for literary work and multimedia work that combines various media types such as text, audio, images, animations, video and interactive content and its collections.

nodes.name: copyright licence
description: A copyright licence is a licence that states the ownership and contractually sets the rights and obligations to use, copy, and distribute a creative work.

nodes.name: software licence
description: A software licence is a copyright licence that determines ownership and permissions for software, code, or models.

nodes.name: subsurface collector
description: A subsurface collector is a heat exchanger that transfers ambient thermal energy to a working fluid. It consists of plastic pipes laid horizontally under the ground.

nodes.name: downhole heat exchanger
description: A downhole heat exchanger is a heat exchanger that transfers ambient thermal energy or geothermal energy to a working fluid. It consists of plastic pipes installed vertically or inclined in a borehole.

nodes.name: rotary heat exchanger
description: A rotary heat exchanger is a heat exchanger that uses a wheel for a heat transfer process.

nodes.name: plate heat exchanger
description: A plate heat exchanger is a heat exchanger that uses a plate for a heat transfer process.

nodes.name: nuclear
description: Nuclear is a conventional origin that indicates that the energy comes originally from nuclear binding energy.

nodes.name: conventional
description: Conventional is an origin of energies that don't replenish when transformed / consumed.

nodes.name: power generation technology
description: A power generation technology is an energy technology that describes how to combine power generating units and energy carriers in a power generation process to generate electrical energy.

nodes.name: energy technology
description: An energy technology is a technology that describes how to combine energy transformation units, energy transformations, energy carriers and energy in a specific way.

nodes.name: wind power technology
description: A wind power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine wind energy converting units and a wind energy transformation.

nodes.name: solar power technology
description: A solar power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine solar power units in an electricity generation process with solar energy as input.

nodes.name: geothermal power technology
description: A geothermal power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine geothermal power units in an electricity generation process with geothermal energy as input.

nodes.name: hydro power technology
description: A hydro power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: nuclear power technology
description: A nuclear power generation technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine nuclear power units and nuclear fuel in an electricity generation process.

nodes.name: fuel power technology
description: A fuel-powered generation technology is a power technology that describes how to combine fuel-powered units in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: onshore wind power technology
description: An onshore wind power technology is a wind power generation technology that describes how to use wind energy converting units in onshore wind farms.

nodes.name: offshore wind power technology
description: An offshore wind power technology is a wind power generation technology that describes how to use wind energy converting units in offshore wind farms.

nodes.name: photovoltaic technology
description: A photovoltaic technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine photovoltaic panels in an electricity generation process with solar energy as input.

nodes.name: solar thermal power technology
description: A solar thermal power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine solar thermal power units in an electricity generation process with solar energy as input.

nodes.name: run of river power technology
description: A reservoir hydro storage power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units in run of river power plant and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: reservoir hydro storage power technology
description: A reservoir hydro storage power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units in reservoir hydro storage power plants and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: marine hydro power technology
description: A marine hydro power technology is a hydro power technology that describes how to combine hydro power units, a hydroelectric energy transformation and oceans.

nodes.name: pumped hydro storage power technology
description: A pumped hydro storage power technology is a power generation technology that describes how to combine hydro power units in pumped hydro storage power plants and a hydroelectric energy transformation.

nodes.name: marine current energy technology
description: A marine current energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine current energy converting units in marine current energy transformations.

nodes.name: marine tidal energy technology
description: A marine tidal energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine tidal energy converting units in marine tidal energy transformations.

nodes.name: marine wave energy technology
description: A marine wave energy technology is a marine hydro power technology that describes how to combine marine wave energy converting units in marine wave energy transformations.

nodes.name: coal power technology
description: A coal power technology is a fuel-powered technology that describes how to combine coal power units and coal in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: hard coal power technology
description: A hard coal power technology is a coal power technology that describes how to combine hard coal power units and hard coal in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: lignite power technology
description: A lignite power technology is a coal power technology that describes how to combine hard coal power units and lignite in a fuel-powered electricity generation process.

nodes.name: study
description: A study is a project with the goal to investigate something.
editor_note: The construct 'has funding source' some ('has role' some funder) is necessary, because has funding source has the range has role some funder. This range comes from issue https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/ontology/issues/850 : funding source is some kind of independent continuant, i.e. a organisation or person, that does something special (giving money). So it is anything that has role some funder.

nodes.name: study report
description: A study report is a report that is the output from some study.

nodes.name: output data
description: Output data is endogenous data that is determined by a model calculation and presented as a result.

nodes.name: endogenous data
description: Endogenous data is a data item whose quantity value is determined by a model.

nodes.name: analytical approach
description: A analytical approach is a model descriptor that contains information about the analysis strategy of a model.

nodes.name: methodical focus
description: A methodical focus is a model descriptor that specifies the primary calculation method used in a model.

nodes.name: primary modelling purpose
description: A primary modelling purpose is a model descriptor stating the main purpose of a model.

nodes.name: uncertainty approach
description: An uncertainty approach is a model descriptor that specifies how a model deals with uncertainty.

nodes.name: top down
description: Top down is an analytical approach where design starts from the system as a whole. The system is then divided into smaller sub-applications with more details. Each part again goes through the top down approach till the complete system is designed with all minute details. Top down approach is also termed as breaking the bigger problem into smaller problems and solving them individually in a recursive manner. A top down model is based on a decomposition approach.

nodes.name: bottom up
description: Bottom up is an analytical approach where parts of the system are defined in details. Once these parts are designed and developed, then these parts or components are linked together to prepare a bigger component. This approach is repeated until the complete system is built. A bottom up model is based on a composition approach.

nodes.name: hybrid
description: Hybrid is an analytical approach that combines the top down and the bottom up approach. Some parts are based on composition approach while other parts are based on decomposition approach.

nodes.name: study region
description: A study region is a spatial region that is under investigation and consists entirely of one or more subregions.

nodes.name: spatial region
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Spatial regions do not participate in processes.

Spatial region doesn't have a closure axiom because the subclasses don't exhaust all possibilites. An example would be the union of a spatial point and a spatial line that doesn't overlap the point, or two spatial lines that intersect at a single point. In both cases the resultant spatial region is neither 0-dimensional, 1-dimensional, 2-dimensional, or 3-dimensional.

nodes.name: subregion
description: A subregion is a spatial region that is a part of spatial region.

nodes.name: considered region
description: A considered region is a spatial region that is used in an analysis.

nodes.name: interacting region
description: An interacting region is a spatial region that interacts with a study region. It is part of a considered region, but not a study region.

nodes.name: study subregion
description: A study subregion is a subregion of a study region.

nodes.name: radiation
description: Radiation is an energy transfer by emitting or transmitting energy in the form of waves or particles through a spatial region or a material entity.

nodes.name: electrical energy transfer
description: Electrical energy transfer is an energy transfer of electrical energy.

nodes.name: chemical energy transfer
description: Chemical energy transfer is an energy transfer of chemical energy.

nodes.name: energy carrier
description: An energy carrier is a material entity that has an energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: material entity
description: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Material entities (continuants) can preserve their identity even while gaining and losing material parts. Continuants are contrasted with occurrents, which unfold themselves in successive temporal parts or phases [60
BFO 2 Reference: Object, Fiat Object Part and Object Aggregate are not intended to be exhaustive of Material Entity. Users are invited to propose new subcategories of Material Entity.

BFO 2 Reference: ‘Matter’ is intended to encompass both mass and energy (we will address the ontological treatment of portions of energy in a later version of BFO). A portion of matter is anything that includes elementary particles among its proper or improper parts: quarks and leptons, including electrons, as the smallest particles thus far discovered; baryons (including protons and neutrons) at a higher level of granularity; atoms and molecules at still higher levels, forming the cells, organs, organisms and other material entities studied by biologists, the portions of rock studied by geologists, the fossils studied by paleontologists, and so on.Material entities are three-dimensional entities (entities extended in three spatial dimensions), as contrasted with the processes in which they participate, which are four-dimensional entities (entities extended also along the dimension of time).According to the FMA, material entities may have immaterial entities as parts – including the entities identified below as sites; for example the interior (or ‘lumen’) of your small intestine is a part of your body. BFO 2.0 embodies a decision to follow the FMA here.

nodes.name: fissile material entity
description: A fissile material entity is a material entity that has the disposition to carry nuclear (binding) energy.

nodes.name: fluid
description: A fluid is a material entity which is a liquid, gas or plasma.

nodes.name: photon
description: A photon is a material entity that is a light particle.

nodes.name: fiat object part
editor_note: BFO 2 Reference: Most examples of fiat object parts are associated with theoretically drawn divisions

nodes.name: renewable energy carrier
description: A renewable energy carrier is an energy carrier that has a renewable energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: primary energy carrier
description: A primary energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the disposition primary energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: secondary energy carrier
description: A secondary energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the secondary energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: final energy carrier
description: A final energy carrier is an energy carrier that has the disposition final energy carrier disposition.

nodes.name: fuel market exchange
description: A fuel market exchange is an energy market exchange where fuels like oil, coal, renewable fuels, and natural gas are traded.

nodes.name: energy market exchange
description: An energy market exchange is a market exchange in which energy commodities are traded.

nodes.name: data licence
description: A data licence is a licence that determines ownership, database protection, and permissions for data.

nodes.name: emission market exchange
description: An emission market exchange is a market exchange where emission certificates are traded

nodes.name: fuel commodity role
