description: A specific volume unit which is equal to one cubic meter volume occupied by one kilogram of a particular substance.

nodes.name: liter per kilogram
description: A specific volume unit which is equal to one liter volume occupied by one kilogram of a particular substance.

nodes.name: milliliter per kilogram
description: A specific volume unit which is equal to a thousandth of a liter per kilogram or 10^[-3] l/kg.

nodes.name: microliter per kilogram
description: A specific volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter per kilogram or 10^[-6] l/kg.

nodes.name: meter per second
description: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 meter distance in one second.

nodes.name: millimeters per day
description: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 millimeter distance in one day.

nodes.name: kilometer per hour
description: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 kilometer distance in one hour.

nodes.name: newton
description: A force unit which is equal to the force required to cause an acceleration of 1m/s2 of a mass of 1 Kg in the direction of the force.

nodes.name: pascal
description: A pressure unit which is equal to the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 1 newton spread over a surface of 1 m^[2].

nodes.name: millimetres of mercury
description: A unit of pressure equal to the amount of fluid pressure one millimeter deep in mercury at zero degrees centigrade on Earth.

nodes.name: watt
description: A power unit which is equal to the power used when work is done at the rate of 1 joule per second.

nodes.name: lux
description: An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 m^[2].

nodes.name: foot candle
description: An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 foot^[2]. One footcandle is equal to 10.76 lux.

nodes.name: lumen
description: A luminous flux unit which is equal to the luminous flux emitted into 1 steradian by a point source of 1 candela.

nodes.name: katal
description: A catalytic unit activity which is equal to the activity of a catalyst in moles per second, such as the amount of an enzyme needed to transform one mole of substrate per second.

nodes.name: enzyme unit
description: A catalytic unit activity which is equal to the amount of the enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of 1 micro mole of substrate per minute.

nodes.name: plane angle unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the angle formed by two straight lines in the same plane.

nodes.name: solid angle unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the angle formed by three or more planes intersecting at a common point.

nodes.name: radian
description: A plane angle unit which is equal to the angle subtended at the center of a circle by an arc equal in length to the radius of the circle, approximately 57 degrees 17 minutes and 44.6 seconds.

nodes.name: degree
description: A plane angle unit which is equal to 1/360 of a full rotation or 1.7453310^[-2] rad.

nodes.name: steradian
description: A solid angle unit which is equal to the solid angle subtended at the center of a sphere by an area on the surface of the sphere that is equal to the radius squared.

nodes.name: activity (of a radionuclide) unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the transformation (disintegration) rate of a radioactive substance.

nodes.name: absorbed dose unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the energy imparted by ionizing radiation to unit mass of matter such as tissue.

nodes.name: dose equivalent unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the expression of dose in terms of its biological effect.

nodes.name: exposure unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the quantity that expresses the ability of radiation to ionize air and thereby create electric charges which can be collected and measured.

nodes.name: effective dose unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the estimate of the stochastic effect that a non-uniform radiation dose has on a human.

nodes.name: becquerel
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second or there is one atom disintegration per second (dps).

nodes.name: curie
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which there are 3.7 x 10^[10] atom disintegration per second (dps).

nodes.name: millicurie
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to one thousandth of a curie or 10^[-3] Ci.

nodes.name: microcurie
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to one millionth of a curie or 10^[-6] Ci.

nodes.name: disintegrations per minute
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per minute or there is one atom disintegration per minute.

nodes.name: counts per minute
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the number of light emissions produced by ionizing radiation in one minute.

nodes.name: disintegrations per second
description: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second or there is one atom disintegration per second.

nodes.name: gray
description: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter.

nodes.name: rad
description: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to 0.01 gray (Gy).

nodes.name: microgray
description: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one millionth of a gray or 10^[-6] Gy.

nodes.name: milligray
description: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gray or 10^[-3] Gy.

nodes.name: nanogray
description: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a gray or 10^[-9] Gy.

nodes.name: roentgen
description: An exposure unit which is equal to the amount of radiation required to liberate positive and negative charges of one electrostatic unit of charge in 1 cm^[3] of air at standard temperature and pressure (STP). This corresponds to the generation of approximately 2.0810^[9] ion pairs.

nodes.name: sievert
description: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter.

nodes.name: millisievert
description: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a sievert or 10^[-3] Sv.

nodes.name: microsievert
description: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one millionth of a sievert or 10^[-6] Sv.

nodes.name: Roentgen equivalent man
description: A dose equivalent unit which when multiplied by hundred is equal to one sievert or 1 Sv. 1 Sv is equal to 100 rem.

nodes.name: nanosievert
description: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a sievert or 10^[-9] Sv.

nodes.name: watt per square meter
description: An irradiance unit which is equal to 1 watt of radiant power incident per one square meter surface area.

nodes.name: einstein per square meter per second
description: An irradiance unit which is equal to one einstein per square meter per second. One einstein is one mole of photons, regardless of their frequency. Therefore, the number of photons in an einstein is Avogadro's number.

nodes.name: microeinstein per square meter per second
description: An irradiance unit which is equal to one microeinstein per square meter per second or 10^[-6] microeinstein/sm^[2].

nodes.name: watt per steradian per square meter
description: A radiance unit which is equal to one watt of radiant power incident per steradian solid angle per one square meter projected area of the source, as viewed from the given direction.

nodes.name: watt per steradian
description: A radiant intensity unit which is equal to one kilogram meter squared per second cubed per steradian.

nodes.name: percent
description: A dimensionless ratio unit which denotes numbers as fractions of 100.

nodes.name: volume percentage
description: A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the volume of the solute in mL per 100 mL of the resulting solution.

nodes.name: purity percentage
description: A dimensionless percent unit which denotes the homogeneity of a biomaterial.

nodes.name: confluence percentage
description: A dimensionless percent unit which denotes the density of an attached or monolayer culture (e.g., cell culture).

nodes.name: milliliter per cubic meter
description: A volume per unit volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter of solute in one cubic meter of solution.

nodes.name: milliliter per liter
description: A volume per unit volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter of solute in one liter of solution.

nodes.name: parts per notation unit
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which describes the amount of one substance in another. It is the ratio of the amount of the substance of interest to the amount of that substance plus the amount of the substance.

nodes.name: pi
description: A dimensionless unit which denoted an irrational real number, approximately equal to 3.14159 which is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter in Euclidean geometry.

nodes.name: count unit
description: A dimensionless unit which denotes a simple count of things.

nodes.name: ratio
description: A dimensionless unit which denotes an amount or magnitude of one quantity relative to another.

nodes.name: absorbance unit
description: A dimensionless logarithmic unit assigned to a measure of absorbance of light through a partially absorbing substance, defined as -log10(I/I_0) where I = transmitted light and I_0 = incident light.

nodes.name: fold dilution
description: A unit that is the ratio of concentration of two solutions of interest, typically with one solution derived from the other by the addition of solvent.

nodes.name: parts per hundred
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 100 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same.

nodes.name: parts per thousand
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same.

nodes.name: parts per million
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[6].

nodes.name: parts per billion
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[9].

nodes.name: parts per trillion
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[12].

nodes.name: parts per quadrillion
description: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[15].

nodes.name: unit per milliliter
description: A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one milliliter.

nodes.name: unit per liter
description: A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one liter.

nodes.name: milliunits per milliliter
description: A unit per milliliter unit which is equal to one thousandth of a unit of an agreed arbitrary amount per one milliliter.

nodes.name: kilogram per meter
description: An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by one meter.

nodes.name: decibel
description: A ratio unit which is an indicator of sound power per unit area.

nodes.name: ratio
description: A dimensionless ratio unit which, given a pair of quantities a and b, for which b is a multiple of a, denotes b by giving the multiplier (coefficient) c for a to result in b.

nodes.name: molecule count
description: A dimensionless count unit which denotes the number of molecules.

nodes.name: colony forming unit
description: A dimensionless count unit which a measure of viable bacterial numbers.

nodes.name: plaque forming unit
description: A dimensionless count unit which a measure of plague forming units in a given volume.

nodes.name: base pair
description: A count unit which contains one nucleotide.

nodes.name: cells per milliliter
description: A unit of cell concentration which is equal to one cell in a volume of 1 milliliter.

nodes.name: cells per microliter
description: A unit of cell concentration which is equal to one cell in a volume of 1 microliter.

nodes.name: cells per well
description: A unit of cell concentration which is equal to 1 cell in a well or discrete container of arbitrary volume.

nodes.name: katal per cubic meter
description: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one cubic meter.

nodes.name: katal per liter
description: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one thousandth of a cubic meter.

nodes.name: colony forming unit per milliliter
description: A colony forming unit which a measure of viable bacterial numbers in one milliliter.

nodes.name: plaque forming unit per milliliter
description: A concentration unit which a measure of plague forming units in one milliliter.

nodes.name: volt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to the work per unit charge. One volt is the potential difference required to move one coulomb of charge between two points in a circuit while using one joule of energy.

nodes.name: millivolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousandth of a volt or 10^[-3] V.

nodes.name: kilovolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousand volts or 10^[3] V.

nodes.name: microvolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one millionth of a volt or 10^[-6] V.

nodes.name: nanovolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one billionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V.

nodes.name: picovolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one trillionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V.

nodes.name: megavolt
description: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one million volts or 10^[6] V.

nodes.name: coulomb
description: An electrical charge unit which is equal to the amount of charge transferred by a current of 1 ampere in 1 second.

nodes.name: weber
description: A magnetic flux unit which is equal to the amount of flux that when linked with a single turn of wire for an interval of one second will induce an electromotive force of one volt.

nodes.name: volt-hour
description: A magnetic flux unit which is equal to 3600 Wb.

nodes.name: kilovolt-hour
description: A magnetic flux unit which is equal to one thousand volt-hours.

nodes.name: tesla
description: A magnetic flux density unit which is equal to one weber per square meter.

nodes.name: bit
description: An information unit which refers to a digit in the binary numeral system, which consists of base 2 digits (ie there are only 2 possible values: 0 or 1).

nodes.name: byte
description: An information unit which is equal to 8 bits.

nodes.name: kilobyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1000 bytes.

nodes.name: megabyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1000 kB.

nodes.name: image resolution unit
description: An information unit which is a standard measure of the detail an image holds.

nodes.name: kibibyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1024 B.

nodes.name: mebibyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1024 KiB.

nodes.name: gigabyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1000000000 bytes.

nodes.name: terabyte
description: An information unit which is equal to 1000 gigabytes.

nodes.name: chroma sampling unit
description: An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the amount of spatial detail in an image.

nodes.name: dynamic range unit
description: An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the amount of contrast available in a pixel.

nodes.name: spatial resolution unit
description: An image resolution unit which is a standard measure of the way luminance and chrominance may be sampled at different levels.

nodes.name: dots per inch
description: A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the printing resolution, in particular the number of individual dots of ink a printer or toner can produce within a linear one-inch space.

nodes.name: micron pixel
description: A spatial resolution unit which is equal to a pixel size of one micrometer.

nodes.name: pixels per inch
description: A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the resolution of a computer display, related to the size of the display in inches and the total number of pixels in the horizontal and vertical directions.

nodes.name: pixels per millimeter
description: A spatial resolution unit which is a standard measure of the number of pixels in one millimeter length or width of a digital image divided by the physical length or width of a printed image.

nodes.name: newton per meter
description: A surface tension unit which is equal to one newton per meter.

nodes.name: dyne per cm
description: A surface tension unit which is equal to one dyne per centimeter.

nodes.name: pascal second
description: A viscosity unit which is equal to one pascale per second.

nodes.name: poise
description: A viscosity unit which is equal to one dyne second per square centimeter.

nodes.name: electrical conduction unit
description: A unit which represents a standard measurement of the movement of electrically charged particles through a transmission medium (electrical conductor).

nodes.name: heat conduction unit
description: A unit which represents a standard measurement of the spontaneous transfer of thermal energy through matter, from a region of higher temperature to a region of lower temperature.

nodes.name: siemens
description: An electrical conduction unit which is equal to A/V.

nodes.name: millisiemens
description: An electrical conduction unit which is equal to one thousandth of a siemen or 10^[-3] siemens.

nodes.name: volt-second per square centimeter
description: An electrical mobility unit which is equal to one volt second per square centimeter.

nodes.name: watt per meter kelvin
description: An heat conduction unit which is equal to one watt divided by meter kelvin.

nodes.name: volt per meter
description: The volt per meter is a unit of electric field strength equal to the a potential difference of 1 volt existing between two points that are 1 meter apart.

nodes.name: microliters per minute
description: A volumetric flow rate unit which is equal to one microliter volume through a given surface in one minute.

nodes.name: ug/disk
description: A unit which is equal to one microgram per disk, where a disk is some physical surface/container upon which the substance is deposited.

nodes.name: nmole/disk
description: A unit which is equal to one nanomole per disk, where a disk is some physical surface/container upon which the substance is deposited.

nodes.name: count per nanomolar second
description: A rate unit which is equal to one over one nanomolar second.

nodes.name: count per molar second
description: A rate unit which is equal to one over one molar second.

nodes.name: count per nanomolar
description: A rate unit which is equal to one over one nanomolar.

nodes.name: count per molar
description: A rate unit which is equal to one over one molar.

nodes.name: yotta
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 24.

nodes.name: hecto
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one hundred.

nodes.name: zetta
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 21.

nodes.name: exa
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 18.

nodes.name: peta
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 15.

nodes.name: tera
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 12.

nodes.name: giga
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten to the power of 9.

nodes.name: mega
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of million.

nodes.name: kilo
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one thousand.

nodes.name: deca
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of ten.

nodes.name: deci
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one tenth.

nodes.name: milli
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one thousand.

nodes.name: centi
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of one hundred.

nodes.name: micro
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -6.

nodes.name: nano
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -9.

nodes.name: pico
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -12.

nodes.name: femto
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -15.

nodes.name: atto
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -18.

nodes.name: zepto
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -21.

nodes.name: yocto
description: A prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10 to the power of -24.

nodes.name: milligram per kilogram
description: A dose unit which is equal to 1 milligram of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per kilogram body weight of the recipient subject.

nodes.name: milligram per square meter
description: A dose unit which is equal to 1 milligram of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per square meter of surface area of the recipient subject.

nodes.name: milligram per kilogram per day
description: A dosage unit which is equal to 1 milligram per day of a toxic or pharmaceutical substance per kilogram body weight of the recipient subject.

nodes.name: relative luminescence unit
description: A relative light unit which is a measure of relative luminescence intensity.

nodes.name: relative fluorescence unit
description: A relative light unit which is a measure of relative fluorescence intensity.

nodes.name: formazin nephelometric unit
description: 1000 formazin turbidity units (FNU) on the empirical formazin turbidity scale represents reflectance of insol. reaction products of 0.0725 g hydrazine sulfate with 0.7250 g hexamethylenetetramine diluted to 1 L.

nodes.name: curie per liter
description: A unit of radioactivity concentration which is equal to one curie in a volume of 1 liter.

nodes.name: microcurie per milliliter
description: A unit of radioactivity concentration which is equal to one micro curie in a volume of 1 liter.

nodes.name: kilobasepair
description: A unit equal to one thousand base pairs.

nodes.name: megabasepair
description: A unit equal to one million base pairs

nodes.name: gigabasepair
description: A unit equal to one billion base pairs.

nodes.name: fathom
description: A maritime length unit which is equal to 6.08 feet, or 1.853184 metres

nodes.name: cable
description: A maritime length unit which is equal to 608 feet, 100 fathoms, or 185.3184 metres

nodes.name: nautical mile
description: A maritime length unit which is equal to 6,080 feet, 10 cables, or 1,853.184 metres
